definition: graceful words, flowery speech (idiom); elegant but insincere words/cheating wheedling/dishonest rhetoric
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
surname Hua
words/speech/to say/to talk
opportunely/coincidentally/as it happens/skillful/timely
dialect/language/speech
to tell to

sentences.english: So much for corporate rhetoric about adding value to commoditized products.
sentences.chinese: 如此多的公司都高談闊論着增加商品價值的花言巧語。

sentences.english: Sheila was too clever to believe Ted's flattery.
sentences.chinese: 希拉聰明過人，不會相信特德的花言巧語。

sentences.english: Only a fool will believe your cajolery.
sentences.chinese: 只有傻瓜纔會相信你那花言巧語的欺騙。

sentences.english: Anthony wheedled. He badgered. He pouted. "Where would you get them?"
sentences.chinese: 安東尼開始花言巧語，繼而糾纏不休，最後撅起了嘴。

sentences.english: You don't want to sweet-talk me.
sentences.chinese: 你甭想花言巧語來騙我。

sentences.english: Don't give me some cooked-up yarn!
He toadies to his aunt, hoping to gain some of her money.
sentences.chinese: 他花言巧語地哄着他姑姑，想從她那兒弄些錢。

sentences.english: The girl did you believe blandishments.
sentences.chinese: 女孩旳花言巧語邇信了麼。

sentences.english: But is by hers some honeyed words, but my heart is also weak down.
sentences.chinese: 可是都是被她的一些花言巧語，而我的心又軟弱下來。

sentences.english: The heady rhetoric of the first two weeks carried us all along.
sentences.chinese: 頭兩週使人興奮的花言巧語讓我們忙個不休。

sentences.english: If time can never, I will choose not to believe your blandishments.
sentences.chinese: 如果時間可以從來，我一定選擇不相信你的花言巧語。

sentences.english: Don't fall for the fair words of the door to door businessmen.
sentences.chinese: 不要相信那些走家串戶的生意人的花言巧語。

sentences.english: She managed to wheedle an extra day's pay out of him.
sentences.chinese: 她花言巧語地騙他多付了一天錢。

sentences.english: Gone were the flowery niceties of democratic theory. Back again was the reality of brutal suppression.
sentences.chinese: 民主的花言巧語隨風而逝，重現殘酷鎮壓的現實。

sentences.english: He wheedled money from his father with considerable finesse.
sentences.chinese: 他耍了個手腕兒花言巧語地從父親那裏得到了錢。

sentences.english: He cajoled the toys out of the child.
sentences.chinese: 他以花言巧語騙取了那小孩的玩具。
